alert.note: Alert for Georgetown; Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 10:41AM EST until December 22 at 8:12AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Georgetown, Horry and Williamsburg. * WHEN...Until 145 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1041 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Surfside Beach, Kingstree, Pawleys Island, Yawkey South Island, Murrells Inlet, Winyah Bay Entrance, Garden City, Andrews, Hemingway, Warsaw, Morrisville, Rhems, Earle, Nesmith, Henry, Sampit, Oatland and Trio. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
